author: @springhsong
text: hi sentdex, thanks for the great tutorials! Could I ask a question about leverage - if an algorithm was using 2x leverage and gets a drawdown of 50% does that mean, 50% of 200% ie 100% loss? many thanks

author: @chrisherrick2397
text: A note about the last code change you made: prior to the change your buy and short quantities were asymmetric with the short quantity applying leverage and the buy quantity not applying leverage; this asymmetry could have contributed to the massive losses suffered by the algorithm.

author: @0xsuperman
text: Thanks Harrison for this tutorial series, to go beyond, I would like to test multiple ML classifiers and vast number and combination of features, and let python to pick a set of those with best performance. Is this a thing?

author: @austinbakanec4952
text: So after programming, testing, and paper trading my algorithm on Quantopian, what are the steps to editing the code, connecting it to a brokerages API, and placing it on a server to run in the real world with real money?

author: @snorrehammermoen3430
text: Hi Harrison, Big fan! Thanks for sharing. Could you add a video on how to use zipline in the quantopian notebook environment, including how to use historical fundamental data for machine learning. A video on how to use Talib would also be interesting. Thanks again!

author: @fernandog8776
text: Thanks for this series, I  have always wanted to program my strategies in python, but just thinking about downloading the data and backtest the strategy hold me back. The series was very useful and I am starting to consider using machine learning in my strategies. I am even considering subscribing for the sentiment API.  Best Regards

author: @richardparker123
text: Hi sentdex,  I recently found your channel. What is your educational and professional background? It's quite rare to have an expert level programmer such as yourself know so much about the financial industry. That is, unless you were/are an algotrader/quant.

author: @xxjaydog71xx
text: Could you get into some uses of Python with sports stats?
